org.jasig.cas.couchbase.core

Class CouchbaseClientFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jasig.cas.couchbase.core.CouchbaseClientFactory

  • public class CouchbaseClientFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory class which produces a client for a particular Couchbase bucket. A design consideration was that we want the server to start even if Couchbase is unavailable, picking up the connection when Couchbase comes online. Hence the creation of the client is made using a scheduled task which is repeated until successful connection is made.
    Since:
    4.2

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Start initializing the client. This will schedule a task that retries connection until successful.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Inverse of initialize, shuts down the client, cancelling connection task if not completed.

      • ensureIndexes

        public void ensureIndexes(java.lang.String documentName,
                 java.util.List<com.couchbase.client.java.view.View> views)
        Register indexes to ensure in the bucket when the client is initialized.
        Parameters:
        documentName - name of the Couchbase design document.
        views - the list of Couchbase views (i.e. indexes) to create in the document.
